title: The 'fighting Islamophobia' books for young adults
description: Fiction books have been providing a "counter-narrative" to anti-Muslim views, research suggests.

title: North Korea propaganda: New faces but old messages
description: Pyongyang is believed to be behind several new YouTube and Twitter accounts aimed at foreign audiences.

title: Ten countries kept out Covid. But did they win?
description: Covid-19 has infected almost every country in the world – apart from 10. So what do they do now?

title: Paris: 'World’s largest urban rooftop farm' in progress
description: A company in Paris is transforming roofs and abandoned urban areas into spaces covered in plants.

title: Panorama investigation: The detainees held 'hostage' in Iran
description: Anoosheh and Nizar were arrested on separate occasions for spying in Iran, charges they both deny.

title: Coronavirus in South Africa: Whistleblower questions winter tent deaths
description: Suspected Covid-19 patients were routinely left in an open tent, in sub-zero temperatures, the BBC finds.

title: The Iranian immigrant who conquered online video tech
description: Shahrzad Rafati is the boss of internet video technology firm BroadbandTV.

title: England v Pakistan: James Anderson sees three chances dropped off his bowling
description: England's James Anderson, currently on 597 Test wickets, sees three chances dropped off his bowling on day three of the third Test against Pakistan in Southampton.

title: England v Pakistan: James Anderson closes in on 600 wickets on day three
description: James Anderson picks up another two wickets as England enforce the follow on against Pakistan despite a century captain Azhar Ali in the third Test.

title: Coronavirus: 'I became alcoholic during lockdown'
description: Chris McLone's story is far from unique, say addiction specialists.

title: Q&A: What is GolfGate and why is it causing Ireland problems?
description: The golf dinner that led to recriminations, resignations and the recall of the Irish parliament.

title: Belarus: Nato denies foreign troops are on border
description: The Belarusian president places the army on alert as he talks of an external military build-up.

title: Thomas Restobar Club: Crush kills 13 as Peru police raid party violating lockdown
description: The crush happens as revellers try to leave a nightclub in the capital Lima.

title: Coronavirus: New £10,000 fines for organisers of illegal raves from Friday
description: Those who attend gatherings in England can also be issued a £100 penalty, doubling on each offence up to £3,200.

title: Coronavirus: Missing school is worse than virus for children - Whitty
description: England's chief medical officer says reopening classrooms carries an "incredibly small" risk to pupils.

title: EU trade commissioner apologises for attending golf dinner
description: Phil Hogan says his attendance at the event with 80 people had "touched a nerve".

title: Bristol Road stabbing: Three more murder arrests
description: Five people have been detained following the death of a man found "slumped" at a roadside.

title: England v Pakistan: James Anderson removes Asad Shafiq for 597th test wicket
description: James Anderson has Asad Shafiq caught at slip by Joe Root to move to 597 Test victims in the third Test between England and Pakistan.

title: Durdle Door beach rescue: Human chain 'saved man's life'
description: More than 20 people linked arms to help save a swimmer in difficulty in water off the Dorset coast.

title: Coronavirus: Food factory cluster cases in Coupar Angus up to 90
description: A total of 79 employees at the 2 Sisters factory have tested positive, plus 11 of their contacts.

title: 'You have to take them out' - Joshua says Whyte must rediscover finishing instinct
description: Anthony Joshua urges Dillian Whyte to rediscover his finishing instinct - and says the British pair could yet face each other.

title: Johnson-Thompson to compete in innovative long jump event in Stockholm
description: Heptathlon world champion Katarina Johnson-Thompson will be part of an innovative long-jump event at Sunday's Stockholm Diamond League

title: Co-ownership: Housing body sees threefold rise in demand
description: Co-Ownership, which helps homebuyers purchase, has processed more than 1,000 applications since July.

title: 'Best team v best player' - what could decide Champions League final?
description: BBC Radio 5 Live's European football experts discuss who will win the 2020 Champions League final between Paris St-Germain and Bayern Munich.

title: California wildfires: Trump declares major disaster
description: One fire tearing through the state is the third largest California has ever seen.

title: Police diversity: 'Why join a force of people you mistrust?'
description: Of 6,999 police officers serving in Wales, just 128 identify as BAME or mixed race, figures show.
